HelpXML.Title: winsor
HelpXML.Purpose: winsor returns a winsorized copy of input

Item.Name: X
Item.LongDesc: Input array, specified as a vector, matrix, or 3D array.
Item.DataType: ingle | double | int8 | int16 | int32 | int64 |uint8 | uint16 | uint32 | uint64

Item.Name: p
Item.TypeInd: Vector of length 2 with elements in the interval [0 100]
Item.LongDesc: Vector of length(2) containing cut-off percentiles (left, right). Note that p(2) must be greater than p(1).
Item.DataType: single | double | int8 | int16 | int32 | int64 |uint8 | uint16 | uint32 | uint64

Item.Name: dim
Item.LongDesc: If no value is specified, then the default is the first array dimension whose size does not equal 1. In other words, if the input is a row (column) vector it winsorizes this row (column) vector. If the input is a nxp matrix it winsorizes the columns. If the input is a 3D arrary of size nxpxq it winsorizes each column of each slice of the 3D array.
Item.DataType: ingle | double | int8 | int16 | int32 | int64 |uint8 | uint16 | uint32 | uint64

Item.Name: Xwins
Item.ShortDesc: Array of the same size of X
Item.LongDesc: In array Xwins all entries smaller than the p(1) quantile have been replaced by this value and likewise for all entries larger than the p(2) quantile. Row, or columns are winsorized depending on optional input scalar dim.

References.Item: Maronna, R.A., Martin D. and Yohai V.J. (2006), Robust Statistics, Theory and Methods, Wiley, New York.

Item.Title: Winsorize each column of matrix X.
Item.Desc: rng('default') Reinitialize the random number generator to its startup configuration

Item.Title: Winsorize each row of 3D array X.
